meanings.definition: Without the use of gloves or other hand coverings.
meanings.sent1: He caught the ball barehanded and threw it back.
meanings.sent2: She picked the flowers barehanded in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The chef cooked barehanded, feeling the dough with his fingers.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted barehanded, creating masterpieces with just his hands.
meanings.sent5: The child played barehanded in the sand, feeling the grains slip through his fingers.

meanings.definition: Using only one's hands, without the aid of tools or weapons.
meanings.sent1: He climbed the tree barehanded, gripping the branches tightly.
meanings.sent2: She opened the jar barehanded, using her strength to twist the lid off.
meanings.sent3: The detective solved the case barehanded, relying on his wit and observation skills.
meanings.sent4: The magician performed the trick barehanded, astonishing the audience with his sleight of hand.
meanings.sent5: The athlete won the race barehanded, crossing the finish line with sheer determination.
